message.content:
cs.CV, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.DM, cs.GR 

Reasoning: The paper deals with the problem of minimizing the Potts energy function in computer vision applications, which is a common problem in the field of computer vision (cs.CV). The paper also discusses the algorithmic techniques used to solve this problem, which involves generalizing the algorithm of Felzenszwalb et al. for tree metrics (cs.DS), and discussing k-submodular functions and k-submodular relaxations for general energy functions (cs.DM). The paper also discusses the runtime complexity of the algorithm, which is relevant to the field of theoretical computer science (cs.TH). Finally, the paper discusses the practical applications of the algorithm, which could be of interest to researchers in machine learning and optimization (cs.LG) and graph theory (cs.GR).
